intro: Pandorea pandorana subsp. austrocaledonica, commonly known as the Northern Territory pandorea, is a climbing shrub native to northern Australia. It features woody stems with thorn-like projections and heart-shaped, dark green leaves. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in gardens and natural reserves.
